name: WiFi HaLow
description:
Currently engaged with Thomas Moore WiSleep project duration 2022 - 2023. Also known as 802.11ah it is the first long-range LPWAN technology with WiFi alliance certification to gaurantee various uses.
Examples of products: https://www.silextechnology.com/connectivity-solutions/wifi-access-point/ap-100ah
Business model impact: Low RF suitable for body implants, assumed to be better adopted in sensitive environments (E.g healthcare, ATEX)
Source: https://www.gartner.com/en/articles/5-impactful-technologies-from-the-gartner-emerging-technologies-and-trends-impact-radar-for-2022
Referrer: Tom Collins

name: Graph databases
description:
Beyond SQL and NoSQL, graph databases are a tool to find meaning across hetrogenous data sources across verticals - making sopshistcated queries possible using temporal, spatial and connectedness

Examples of products: Neo4j, MongoDB
Examples of companies:
Business model impact: Data analysis services for Big Data
Source: https://www.gartner.com/en/articles/5-impactful-technologies-from-the-gartner-emerging-technologies-and-trends-impact-radar-for-2022
Referrer: Tom Collins

name: ATEX Safety Drone
description:
Small scale inspection drone for dangerous environments in chemical/oil sectors etc

Business model impact: New use cases, private networking cases
Source: www.atexshop.com/explosion-proof-drone-intrinsically-safe.html
Referrer: Tom Collins

name: LoRaWAN People Counter [example]
description:
A low cost people counter for commerical buildings that can be used with a private LoRaWAN network.

Reason for interest: Cost and accuracy should be explored
Comparable to:
Examples of products: https://www.imbuildings.com/lorawan-people-counter/
Examples of companies:
Business model impact: New use cases, private networking cases
Source:
Referrer: Tom Collins

name: OpenVAS (Vulnerabiltiy Assessment Scanner)[example]
description: OpenVAS is a full-featured vulnerability scanner. Its capabilities include unauthenticated and authenticated testing, various high-level and low-level internet and industrial protocols, performance tuning for large-scale scans and a powerful internal programming language to implement any type of vulnerability test.

name: OAI-5G CN
description:
3GPP-Compliant 5G Standalone (SA) CN implementation with a rich feature set. OAI 5G CN is designed and implemented in a flexible way which can be easily adapted to fulfill the needs of diversified 5G use-cases. All the features of the OAI 5G CN components are continuously tested with professional testers, commercial gNBs (with COTS UE) and open-source RAN simulators.  

Current plans are to assess features with the Firecell labkit
Source of the item: Is in use with the Firecell 4G/5G Lab evaluation kit that used by the research team

name: Intent-based networking
description:
Intent-based networking is a software-enabled automation process that uses high levels of intelligence, analytics, and orchestration to improve network operations and uptime. When operators describe the business outcomes they wish to accomplish, the network converts those objectives into the configuration necessary to achieve them, without individual tasks having to be coded and executed manually.


Currently we trial a solution from https://inmanta.com for testing 5G CNs. 

It is relatable to the 5GECO ICON project also proposes similar goals through Intelligent Neutral Host infrastructure

name: SimpleRAN
5G Cellular-V2X
description:
Technology for doing V2X, added in 3GPP Rel-16. 

Qualcomm seems to be working a lot on this. 

https://www.qualcomm.com/products/application/automotive/c-v2x
https://5gaa.org/

description: Noted by research team as a low-cost robotics platform for development

description:
As a member of IMEC's Wireless Community, Citymesh gets insights various wireless technologies. RTLS and ultrawide band have been a recent topic

Examples of companies: www.pozyx.io
Business model impact: New type of FFAI New use cases, private networking cases

name: Open5GS CN
description:
An open-source 5G core - currently being tested and planned use in the 5GECO project

Current plans are to assess features with the Firecell labkit. Tested and running locally on Linux no results with RAN access yet

name: 5G Lab/Evaluation kit
description:
Beyond dedicated production 5G RAN/Cores we aim to find suitable tools to support design/development of specific features or software in a 5G ecosystem

Examples were evaluated here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10cEcjzW1guorAZ3s0nS776xDhPG7ixdzWdD4moS0vMk/edit?usp=sharing

Firecell lab kit was selected and PO made - Kit expected early 2023

name: Magma 5G CN
description:
An open-source OAI-based 5G core supported by Meta, ARM, qualcomm, redhat, aarna, amd, helium 

Current plans are to assess features with the Firecell labkit

name: FreedomFi - Community driven open-5G networks with crypto
description:
https://freedomfi.com uses certified base stations hosted by normal people and incentivised with Helium crypto. See Helium LPWAN for more.

FreedomFi is revolutionizing wireless by building an Open 5G mobile network leveraging open source software, flexible spectrum, blockchain, and community participation to increase access, expand coverage, and lower costs for everyone. Founded by open source software veterans and telecom experts, the company is one of the top contributors of code to project Magma, which is governed by the Linux Foundation and is quickly emerging as the standard for decentralized wireless infrastructure. FreedomFi is backed by Blueyard Capital, Qualcomm Ventures and Samsung Next.

Current plans: No plans but interesting to know

name: Aerial 5G Relays - E.g UAV, Balloons
description:
mmWave based aerial deployment of 5G https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3508396.3512874

Current plans: Noneyet, this is supra levels of innovation

Example company: https://www.stratosphericplatforms.com/

"the advantage of our aircraft is that typically one aircraft can replace around 450 masts on the ground.”

name: 5G mmWave Extended Range - 5G innovation allowing 7km range line of sight
description:
Standard mmWave is considered for hundreds of metres. mmWave Extended Range claims 7km support

Ericsson article: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/stamp/stamp.jsp?arnumber=9954447

name: Starlink (& marine)
description: Starlink High-speed, low-latency broadband internet in remote and rural locations across the globe. $110/mo with a one-time hardware cost of $599. Starlink Maritime is $5,000 per month. There is no contract, users can cancel at any time. Users can also pause service for seasonal usage. There is a one-time fee of $10,000 for the Starlink Maritime hardware kit, which includes two Business dishes and mounting accessories

name: 6G Cell-free networking
description:
A concept moving mobile networks away from cell-based topographies and towards overlapping bubbles with the possibliity for multiple APs provide connectivity to a single UE. Optimised for bandwidth and energy usage.
Good description here: https://www.rfwireless-world.com/Terminology/Difference-between-cellular-network-and-cell-free-network.html
Citymesh has been asked by KU Leuven to provide feedback on an internal research track on this topic - under LOI.

name: 6TiSCH
description:
A concept for IPv6 over the TSCH mode of IEEE 802.15.4e (layer requirements for wireless personal area networks) low-cost, low-data-rate wireless access technology for devices that are operated or work on batteries.
This technology is being researched by various universities in Belgium and was presented at a Wireless Community event 2022 Q4

name: Matter
description:
The Matter protocol is a royalty-free home automation connectivity standard, with manufacturers only incurring certification costs. Matter is a unified, open-source application-layer connectivity standard built to enable developers and device manufacturers to connect and build reliable, and secure ecosystems and increase compatibility among connected home devices. It is built with market-proven technologies using Internet Protocol (IP) and is compatible with Thread and Wi-Fi network transports.
Good FAQ: https://matter-smarthome.de/en/matter-faq-en/
Official website: https://csa-iot.org/all-solutions/matter/

name: Satellite-to-mobile
description: Consider actions by AST SpaceMobile and Lynk Global allow direct cell signals to be received by normal hand sets

name: 5G Network visibilty
description: Consider https://www.mantisnet.com/products/

name: Network Performance Management (NPM)
description: Next to intent-based networking - performance monitoring is seeing a new wave of intelligent monitoring solutions. "The collection of methods that manage, enable, and ensure a computer network’s optimal performance levels. Typically, network performance management demands the routine monitoring of quality and performance service levels for each network component and device"

name: Open API for 5G third-parties
description: DT has an early access program to their 5G API https://www.hubraum.com/5g-early-access-program-improving-our-apis/
